mound; policeman's beat

purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 岗)
Pictophonetic: 岡 indicates the sound; 山 (mountain) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 崗位 [ gǎng wèi ]: a post; a job
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 山 [ shān ] mountain, hill, peak
    • 岡 [ gāng ] ridge or crest of hill
heisig_chinese_memo: This hillock is just a ridge of a hill compared to the mountain in the background.
Ru_trainchinese:
gǎng: (сущ) холм, горка; бугор; пост, караул
gāng: (графема) гребень (горы, холма); невысокий холм (одинак. с 冈)
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A hillock (a small hill) is the size of just the ridge of a hill of normal size.  Both of smaller than a mountain of course.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " mountain " to " oka " sound. " Gang " is the differentiated word for " Gang ", which means mountain ridge. "Ji Yun. "Tang Yun": "Gang, custom made post." Such as "Selected Works. Ban Shupi "Bei Zheng Fu": "Cheng Linggang to Deng descend, Xi Xun Xie the township." "The Biographies of Shen Qingzhi": "The old muscles are exhausted, and they will return to Nangang on foot." Wang Changling of the Tang Dynasty, "From Chenshan Pass to Dieshiwan Savage Room, Send Zhang No.11": "Stacked sands are piled up as hills, collapsed and stripped of rain and dew.

" Gang " means soil slope by extension. Since people generally stand at a higher position when defending guards, " post " has the meaning of post and sentry post. For example, paragraph 47 of Lao She's "Four Generations Under One Roof": "The yard suddenly added more posts. The Japanese who came out and went in were as nervous and busy as ants moving." Zhang Yigong "Mountain Village Poet": ""Stop" her mother yelled, from the opposite vegetable field She came out of the small grass nunnery. It turned out that she was standing in a dark post."

In modern Chinese, the usage of the two characters " gang " and "冈" are different. " Gang " means ridge, and " post " means soil slope, post, etc.
humanum_short_description_en: From " mountain " to " oka " sound. " Gang " is a differentiated word for " Gang ", which means ridges and mountains, and is extended to post.
humanum_full_description:
從「山」，「岡」聲。「崗」是「岡」的分化字，表示山脊。《集韻．唐韻》：「岡，俗作崗。」如《文選．班叔皮〈北征賦〉》：「乘陵崗以登降，息郇邠之邑鄉。」《宋書．沈慶之列傳》：「朽老筋力盡，徒步還南崗。」唐代王昌齡〈出郴山口至疊石灣野人室中寄張十一〉：「疊沙積為崗，崩剝雨露幽。」

　　「崗」引申表示土坡。由於防守警衛時，人一般站在比較高的位置，故「崗」又引申出崗位、崗哨的意思。如老舍《四世同堂》47段：「院中忽然增多了崗位。出來進去的日本人像螞蟻搬家那麼緊張忙碌。」張一弓《山村詩人》：「『站住』她娘喊叫着，從對面菜地的小草庵裏鑽了出來。原來她站着暗崗。」

　　現代漢語中，「崗」和「岡」兩個字的用法有區別。「岡」表示山脊，「崗」則指土坡、崗位等。
humanum_short_description: 從「山」，「岡」聲。「崗」是「岡」的分化字，表示山脊、山嶺，引申為崗位。

崗位 [ gǎng wèi ]: a post; a job
(Simplified: 岗)
Pictophonetic: 岡 indicates the sound; 山 (mountain) conveys the meaning.
HSK: 6
Chinese: This hillock is just a ridge of a hill compared to the mountain in the background.
Meaning: hillock
Hanzi: 岗
Story: A hillock (a small hill) is the size of just the ridge of a hill of normal size. Both of smaller than a mountain of course.
Kind: traditional

從「 山 」，「 岡 」聲。「 崗 」是「 岡 」的分化字，表示山脊。《集韻．唐韻》：「岡，俗作崗。」如《文選．班叔皮〈北征賦〉》：「乘陵崗以登降，息郇邠之邑鄉。」《宋書．沈慶之列傳》：「朽老筋力盡，徒步還南崗。」唐代王昌齡〈出郴山口至疊石灣野人室中寄張十一〉：「疊沙積為崗，崩剝雨露幽。」 「 崗 」引申表示土坡。由於防守警衛時，人一般站在比較高的位置，故「 崗 」又引申出崗位、崗哨的意思。如老舍《四世同堂》47段：「院中忽然增多了崗位。出來進去的日本人像螞蟻搬家那麼緊張忙碌。」張一弓《山村詩人》：「『站住』她娘喊叫着，從對面菜地的小草庵裏鑽了出來。原來她站着暗崗。」 現代漢語中，「 崗 」和「 岡 」兩個字的用法有區別。「 岡 」表示山脊，「 崗 」則指土坡、崗位等。
From " mountain" to " oka" sound. " Gang" is the differentiated word for " Gang", which means mountain ridge. "Ji Yun. "Tang Yun": "Gang, custom made post." Such as "Selected Works. Ban Shupi "Bei Zheng Fu": "Cheng Linggang to Deng descend, Xi Xun Xie the township." "The Biographies of Shen Qingzhi": "The old muscles are exhausted, and they will return to Nangang on foot." Wang Changling of the Tang Dynasty, "From Chenshan Pass to Dieshiwan Savage Room, Send Zhang No.11": "Stacked sands are piled up as hills, collapsed and stripped of rain and dew. " Gang" means soil slope by extension. Since people generally stand at a higher position when defending guards, " post" has the meaning of post and sentry post. For example, paragraph 47 of Lao She's "Four Generations Under One Roof": "The yard suddenly added more posts. The Japanese who came out and went in were as nervous and busy as ants moving." Zhang Yigong "Mountain Village Poet": ""Stop" her mother yelled, from the opposite vegetable field She came out of the small grass nunnery. It turned out that she was standing in a dark post." In modern Chinese, the usage of the two characters " gang" and " 冈" are different. " Gang" means ridge, and " post" means soil slope, post, etc.

崗字的汉语字典释义

[①]［gāng］
［《廣韻》古郎切，平唐，見。］
同“岡1”。“岗1”的繁体字。
山脊；山岭。
[②]［gǎng］
“岗2”的繁体字。
(1)岗位；岗哨。
(2)见“崗2子”。

【寅集中】【山字部】　崗； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页314第10
【正字通】俗?字。
